cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 mi SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the central Texas coast, then expected to meander inland over Texas and southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Port O'Connor–Corpus Christi area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch Port Mansfield TX to High Island TX; Hurricane watch north of Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass TX; Tropical-storm watch Boca de Catan MX to Port Mansfield TX and north of San Luis Pass to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: None (warnings anticipated for parts of TX coast Thursday)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coastline and portions of southwest Louisiana; outer rain bands likely to spread to the lower Mississippi Valley
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (outer-band rainfall 3–9 in possible across lower MS Valley)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible early next week
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (<3 ft) cannot be ruled out with prolonged onshore flow, but significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 3–6 in. of rain Sunday–Tuesday from outer rain bands; localized higher totals possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents in the northern Gulf beginning this weekend
